I don't know what  the 1 1/2 hour appointment is supposed to be about. Do I need an extra pair of ears or should I just go on my own? I don't want to go by myself, but I also don't want to make someone sit alone waiting for me. Any advise? Dx 2/18/2011, DCIS, 1cm, Stage I, Grade 3, 0/6 nodes, ER+/PR+ Log in to post a reply

Posts.Title: 1st Radiation Appointment - help! shoema shoema

Posts.Content: Mar 16, 2011 12:10PM shoema wrote: I had my first visit today and the onc gave me a very different view of my tumor than the surgeon. The surgeon said my tumor was very aggressive and the onc said moderate. The surgeon said most likely chemo and the onc said he thinks drugs may do the job. I am still waiting for Onco-type DS test? to come back, but now I don't know how to feel. Do I become hopeful that I may not need chemo or do I stay in the chemo-mindset? I would rather be pleasantly surprised than go back and forth. The funny thing, they were both in a group meeting last week looking at the slides of my tumor and at that time all 9 on the panel agreed that it was most likely going to need chemo. I am very conflicted about where to go with this in my head. Is this common? doctors saying different things?

Posts.Content: shoema wrote: I had my first visit Tuesday and the onc gave me a very different view of my possible treatment than the surgeon. The surgeon said my tumor was very aggressive and the onc said moderate. The surgeon said most likely chemo and the onc said he thinks drugs may do the job. Of course I have to wait for the report. I am still waiting for Oncotype test to come back, but now I don't know how to feel. Do I become hopeful that I may not need chemo or do I stay in the chemo-mindset? I would rather be pleasantly surprised than go back and forth. The funny thing, they were both in a group meeting last week looking at the slides of my tumor and at that time all 9 on the panel agreed that it was most likely going to need chemo. I am very conflicted about where to go with this in my head. Is this common? doctors saying different things?  Dx 2/18/2011, DCIS, 1cm, Stage I, Grade 3, 0/6 nodes, ER+/PR+ Log in to post a reply
